meanings.def: used when you are naming people or things, describing them or giving more information about them
examples: + noun Today is Monday.
‘Who is that?’ ‘It's my brother.’
She's a great beauty.
Susan is a doctor.
He wants to be (= become) a pilot when he grows up.
+ adj. It's beautiful!
Life is unfair.
He is ten years old.
‘How are you?’ ‘I'm very well, thanks.’
Be quick!
be (that)… The fact is (that) we don’t have enough money.
be doing something The problem is getting it all done in the time available.
be to do something The problem is to get it all done in the time available.

meanings.def: used when you are describing a situation or saying what you think about it
examples: + adj. It was really hot in the sauna.
It's strange how she never comes to see us any more.
He thinks it's clever to make fun of people.
+ noun It would be a shame if you lost it.
It's going to be a great match.

meanings.def: to exist; to be present
examples: Is there a God?
Once upon a time there was a princess…
I tried phoning but there was no answer.
There's a bank down the road.
Was there a pool at the hotel?

meanings.def: to be located; to be in a place
examples: The town is three miles away.
If you're looking for your file, it's on the table.
Mary's upstairs.

meanings.def: used to say where somebody was born or where their home is
examples: She's from Italy.

meanings.def: to happen at a time or in a place
examples: The party is on Friday evening.
The meetings are always in the main conference room.

meanings.def: to remain in a place
examples: She has been in her room for hours.
They're here till Christmas.

meanings.def: to attend an event; to be present in a place
examples: I'll be at the party.
He'll be here soon (= will arrive soon).

meanings.def: used to talk about time
examples: + noun It's two thirty.
+ adj. It was late at night when we finally arrived.

meanings.def: to cost
examples: ‘How much is that dress?’ ‘Eighty dollars.’

meanings.def: to be equal to
examples: Three and three is six.
How much is a thousand pounds in euros?
Let x be the sum of a and b.
London is not England (= do not think that all of England is like London).

meanings.def: to visit or call
examples: I've never been to Spain.
He had been abroad many times.
(British English) Has the postman been yet?

meanings.def: used to say what something is made of
examples: Is your jacket real leather?

meanings.def: used to say who something belongs to or who it is intended for
examples: be mine, yours, etc. The money's not yours, it's John's.
be for me, you, etc. This package is for you.

meanings.def: used to say how important something is to somebody
examples: Money isn't everything (= it is not the only important thing).
A thousand dollars is nothing to somebody as rich as he is.

meanings.def: as somebody/something used to be called
examples: Jill Davis that was (= before her marriage)
the Soviet Union, as was

meanings.def: the most important part; all that matters
examples: Her career is the be-all and end-all of her existence.

meanings.def: used to show that you are surprised and annoyed by something that somebody has done
examples: Someone's been and parked in front of the entrance!

meanings.def: used to say that somebody/something stopped somebody/something from happening
examples: If it weren't for you, I wouldn't be alive today.

meanings.def: used to show that you accept that something negative cannot be changed
examples: I never imagined that our company share prices would fall so low, but it is what it is.

meanings.def: to leave somebody/something alone without bothering them/it
examples: Leave her be, she obviously doesn't want to talk about it.
Let the poor dog be (= don't annoy it).

meanings.def: future
examples: his bride-to-be
mothers-to-be (= pregnant women)

idioms.def: as somebody/something used to be called
examples: Jill Davis that was (= before her marriage)
the Soviet Union, as was

idioms.def: the most important part; all that matters
examples: Her career is the be-all and end-all of her existence.

idioms.idiom: (he, she, etc. has) been and done something
idioms.def: used to show that you are surprised and annoyed by something that somebody has done
examples: Someone's been and parked in front of the entrance!

idioms.def: used to say that somebody/something stopped somebody/something from happening
examples: If it weren't for you, I wouldn't be alive today.

idioms.def: used to show that you accept that something negative cannot be changed
examples: I never imagined that our company share prices would fall so low, but it is what it is.

idioms.def: to leave somebody/something alone without bothering them/it
examples: Leave her be, she obviously doesn't want to talk about it.
Let the poor dog be (= don't annoy it).
his bride-to-be
mothers-to-be (= pregnant women)

meanings.def: used with a present participle to form progressive tenses
examples: I am studying Chinese.
I'll be seeing him soon.
What have you been doing this week?
I'm always being criticized.

meanings.def: used to make question tags (= short questions added to the end of statements)
examples: You're not hungry, are you?
Ben's coming, isn't he?
The old theatre was pulled down, wasn't it?

meanings.def: used with a past participle to form the passive
examples: He was killed in the war.
Where were they made?
The house was still being built.
You will be told what to do.

meanings.def: used to avoid repeating the full form of a verb in the passive or a progressive tense
examples: Karen wasn't beaten in any of her games, but all the others were.
‘Are you coming with us?’ ‘No, I'm not.’

meanings.def: used to say what must or should be done
examples: I am to call them once I reach the airport.
You are to report this to the police.
What is to be done about this problem?

meanings.def: used to say what is arranged to happen
examples: They are to be married in June.

meanings.def: used to say what happened later
examples: He was to regret that decision for the rest of his life (= he did regret it).

meanings.def: used to say what could not or did not happen
examples: Anna was nowhere to be found (= we could not find her anywhere).
He was never to see his wife again (= although he did not know it would be so at the time, he did not see her again).
She wanted to write a successful novel, but it was not to be (= it turned out never to happen).

meanings.def: used to express a condition
examples: If we were to offer you more money, would you stay?
Were we to offer you more money, would you stay?

meanings.def: to make or treat somebody/something as
examples: Don't belittle his achievements (= say they are not important).
An older girl befriended me.

meanings.def: wearing or covered with
examples: heavily bejewelled fingers
bespattered with mud

meanings.def: to cause something to be
examples: The ship was becalmed (= there was no wind so it could not move).
The rebels besieged the fort.

meanings.def: used to turn intransitive verbs (= without an object) into transitive verbs (= with an object)
examples: She is always bemoaning her lot.
